body_html:
I'm running a Mac version and only with CPU support, so device placement can't be the reason, can it?

The model is big and hairy. I'll see about localizing it, but I don't think it'll be easy. Maybe this is helpful: if I set input dropout (in an LSTM) to some value, say 0.2, it fails, but then other nearby values, like 0.25, pass just fine (well up to 5 training steps).

body:
I'm running a Mac version and only with CPU support, so device placement can't be the reason, can it?

The model is big and hairy. I'll see about localizing it, but I don't think it'll be easy. Maybe this is helpful: if I set input dropout (in an LSTM) to some value, say 0.2, it fails, but then other nearby values, like 0.25, pass just fine (well up to 5 training steps).
